1.q_string: To express the size of a molecule and an atom, a small size unit called the ____ is used.
Which of the following units denotes the dimensions [ML<sup>2</sup>/Q<sup>2</sup>], where 'Q' represents the electric charge?
If the velocity of light 'c', gravitational constant 'G' and Planck's constant 'h' are chosen as fundamental units, then the dimensions of length 'L' in the new system will be
If 'C' and 'R' respectively denote capacitance and resistance, then what will be the dimensions of 'CR'?

If a vernier calliper is used for measurement and the zero mark of the vernier scale does not coincide with the zero mark of the main scale, then which of the following errors will be shown in the result?

Which of the following is the most precise device for measuring length?

(a) A vernier calliper with 20 divisions on the sliding scale

(b) A screw gauge of pitch 1 mm and 100 divisions on the circular scale

(c) An optical instrument that can measure length within a wavelength of light
The error and the correction to be made when the zeroth division of the head scale in a screw gauge is above the index line of the pitch scale are _____ and _____, respectively.
What is 3.127 rounded off to 2 significant figures?

When a current of 2.5 ± 0.5 A flows through a wire, it develops a potential difference of 20 ± 1 volt. What is the resistance of the wire?
